company_description:

about_the_job:
A Field Technical Support role typically involves providing technical assistance and support to customers, field sales representatives (Commercial team), and internal teams (Marketing and regulatory/Quality Assurance team). The primary focus is on ensuring that the company's products related to animal health are effectively utilized and meet the customers' needs.
The Junior Field Technical Support position is responsible for delivering technical support and expertise to customers, field sales representatives, and internal teams within the animal health business. The role involves troubleshooting, fieldwork, training, and ensuring the optimal use of the company's animal health products.
Key Responsibilities:
* Provide technical assistance to customers, veterinarians, and other stakeholders in the proper use and application of animal health products.
* Address customer inquiries, concerns, and issues related to product performance and functionality.
* Collaborate with field sales representatives to deliver on-site technical support, including product demonstrations, trials, training sessions, and troubleshooting.
* Conduct regular visits to selected customers/farms, and other customer locations to assess product usage and address any technical challenges.
* Develop and deliver training programs for customers and internal teams on the proper use, handling, and maintenance of the products.
* Stay informed about industry trends, regulations, and advancements to provide up-to-date information during training sessions.
* Create and update technical documentation, including user manuals (procedures), troubleshooting guides, and FAQs, to assist customers in resolving issues independently.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and product development, to relay customer feedback, technical issues, and product improvement suggestions.
* Collect and analyze data on product performance, customer feedback, and market trends to contribute to the improvement of existing products and the development of new ones.
* Prepare and submit regular reports on customer interactions, technical issues, and field activities to management.
Qualifications:
* Veterinarian.
* Knowledge of poultry health products, veterinary medicine, and related technical aspects.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to travel to customer locations as needed.
* Problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
* Previous experience in a similar technical support role or the animal health industry is advantageous but not mandatory for this position

Active engagement to ensure local users are trained in IT solutions and aware of relevant IT updates. Active involvement in local security, financial management and asset management.

 End User (Technical) Support 

Responsible to proactively improve the end-user productivity and experience in own region. Influence the IT experience of the user and minimize the need to contact the IT Services helpdesk. Be THE go-to person for local management and users in case of IT and OT questions and issues that need follow up. Arrange proper follow up from global resolver groups and monitor timely and adequate resolution. Be the local host for IT projects where needed and act as the process coach for IT processes, supporting AkzoNobel users in utilizing the IT processes and resources in the most effective manner.

Resulting in, Local IT and OT questions are properly answered, issues are timely and adequately resolved. Adequate local support is given to global IT project teams where needed.

Training and Communication

Communicate relevant IT and OT updates monthly to all local stakeholders. Provide regular training sessions on global IT solutions. Actively scan training needs in local area and follow up on these needs.

Resulting in, local stakeholders are adequately informed on IT updates where needed. Local users adequately training in how to use IT solutions.

 Incident and Problem Management 

Ensure incidents are allocated to the correct IT resolver groups. Monitor all IT incidents escalated by users in the local domain, work with partner escalation teams (HCL, TCS) and our own Service Delivery team to ensure proper follow-up.

Resulting in, incidents, problems, and escalations timely and adequately followed up. Local Management gets active feedback on open escalations. No escalations take longer than 30 days to get solved.

Resulting in, local IT costs are fully transparent & effectively processed. Good local collaboration with local financial controllers.
